DOC.brief_summary: Patients with nonerosive reflux disease (NERD) are less responsive to standard treatment with proton pump inhibitors. The hypothesis of this study was that nortriptyline in analgesic doses may decrease heartburn perception and its corresponding cortical activity measured by magnetic resonance image. Therefore, the aim of this study was to assess the cortical representation of heartburn in patients with NERD under treatment with nortriptyline and placebo.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Nortriptyline in Cortical Representation of Heartburn in Nonerosive Reflux Disease (NERD) Patients
DOC.criteria: more than 17 years old, heartburn at least twice a week, naive to antireflux medications and antidepressive agents active esophagitis at endoscopy, contraindications to nortriptyline use
